news_header: The Nobel Prize announcements for various categories occur this week, culminating in the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo. Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun received the Nobel Prize for their research on micro-RNA and gene regulation.
news_text: This week features important announcements related to the Nobel Prizes, starting with the physics and African Prize on Tuesday, followed by the Literature Prize on Thursday, and concluding with the Nobel Peace Prize in Oslo on Friday. Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun were awarded the Nobel Prize for their groundbreaking work on micro-RNA, which plays a vital role in regulating genetic activity and has implications for diseases like cancer and diabetes. Their research revealed a new gene-regulatory system, and their findings were published in the journal Cell. The Nobel Prize Foundation distributes awards based on Alfred Nobel's assets, with each winner receiving a medal, honorary recognition, and a monetary prize valued at approximately EUR 1 million. The awards ceremony will take place in Stockholm in December.
